channel.title: Assembly for Human Rights: Montreal
channel.description:
Highlights from the Assembly for Human Rights held in 1968 at Montreal. This prog.: Recent Progress in Human Rights and Main Challenges Ahead. Louis B. Sohn, Harvard U.; George Aronstein, Belgian League for the Rights of Man; see also next entry for info.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Women's Rights
item.description: This prog.: Women's Rights. Mrs. helvi Sipila, delegate of the UN Commission on the Status of Women; Sir H.O.B. Wooding, Court of Appeals, Trinidad and Tobago; Justice Haim H. Cohn, Israel Supreme Court; Manouchehr Ganji
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Outlook in Three Typical Democracie
item.description: This prog.: Human Rights Outlook in Three Typical Democracies. Maxwell Cohen, McGill U., Montreal; Judge Gustav Petren, Sweden; E.R. Richardson, Ambassador to U.S. from Jamaica.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Meet the Delegate
item.description: This prog.: Meet the Delegate. Chief S.O. Adebo, Nigeria, Undersecretary-General, U.N.; A.A. Mohammed, Nigeria, U.S. Commission on Human Rights; Anton Vratusa, Yugoslavia, Ambassador to the U.N.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Summing Up
item.description: This prog.: Summing Up. Dr. William Korey, director, B'nai Brith U.N. Office; Rev. Herschel Halbert; Manouchehr Ganji, Iran; Clark Eichelberger, U.N. Association of the U.S.; Leslie Paffrath, moderator
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Science and Technology as Threats
item.description: This prog.: Science and Technology as Threats to Human Rights. Lord Ritchie-Calder, science writer and analyst, U. of Edinburgh.
